Package it.polimi.ingsw.gui

Class SwingView

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.utils.Observable<PlayerAction>
it.polimi.ingsw.client.View
it.polimi.ingsw.gui.SwingView
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer<ServerResponse>
public class SwingView
extends View
Class that implements the user view of the game, if he selects to use the Graphic User Interface

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    SwingView()
    Constructor of the client view with Swing GUI

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void buildGod​(Pack pack, Cell targetCell)
    In case a player wants to use the power of Demeter or Hestia (the cases where you can build twice) the buttonHandler call this method (twice) to save the two targetCell.

    void displayGui​(CellButton[][] battlefieldGUI, ModelUtils modelCopy, java.util.List<Cell> validMoves)
    Here i print the GUI for the user, depending on the parameter validMoves; -if it is null, i print the normal battlefield with the tokens on -otherwise i print even a green backgrounds behind the cells in the ValidMoves param.

    • computeTokens

      public java.util.List<Token> computeTokens​(int posX, int posY)
      When needed, it returns the token that has just been selected from the user, and even the not selected one (it can be useful).
      Parameters:
      posX - : the first input of the user, i.e. the column of the battlefield.
      posY - : the second input of the user, i.e. the row of the battlefield.
      Returns:
      a list containing the selected and the not selected token.

    • computeOpponentPlayers

      public java.util.List<Player> computeOpponentPlayers​(ServerResponse serverResponse)
      When needed, it returns the opponent players(1 or 2) of the player associated to this view.
      Parameters:
      serverResponse - : the response passed throught the observers from the server.
      Returns:
      a list containing the opponent players.

    • notifyClient

      public void notifyClient​(PlayerAction playerAction) throws java.io.IOException
      Calls the notify to make update the observers
      Overrides:
      notifyClient in class View
      Parameters:
      playerAction - action of the player
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if can't send object into the socket

    • update

      public void update​(ServerResponse serverResponse) throws java.io.IOException
      This method moves the mechanic of the game: it receives the response from the server, and creates the respective action of the player.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer<ServerResponse>
      Overrides:
      update in class View
      Parameters:
      serverResponse - : response received from the server containing all the necessary information
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if can't send object into the socket

    • displayGui

      public void displayGui​(CellButton[][] battlefieldGUI, ModelUtils modelCopy, java.util.List<Cell> validMoves) throws java.io.IOException
      Here i print the GUI for the user, depending on the parameter validMoves; -if it is null, i print the normal battlefield with the tokens on -otherwise i print even a green backgrounds behind the cells in the ValidMoves param.
      Parameters:
      validMoves - : cells that have to be printed on a green background (can be null)
      modelCopy - : contains the the board of the game and the players in the game
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • displayInnerGui

      public void displayInnerGui​(CellButton[][] battlefieldGUI, Battlefield battlefield, java.util.List<Player> allPlayers, int y, int x) throws java.io.IOException
      Auxiliary method to print the GUI, here i check the token position's
      Parameters:
      battlefield - : the board of the game
      allPlayers - : the players in the game
      x - : position x of the battlefield
      y - : position y of the battlefield
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • selectIcon

      public javax.swing.ImageIcon selectIcon​(java.util.List<Player> allPlayers, Player player, Cell cell, boolean isDome, boolean iHaveToDisplayValidMoves) throws java.io.IOException
      It selects the right image depending on the characteristics
      Parameters:
      player - : if it's not null, that one is the player on that cell
      cell - : the cell in which i have to put the icon
      iHaveToDisplayValidMoves - auto explicative
      Returns:
      ImageIcon of the cell to display
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • switchOnHeight

      public javax.swing.ImageIcon switchOnHeight​(int height, Pics p1, Pics p2, Pics p3, Pics p4) throws java.io.IOException
      Switch on dynamic images to choose which one has to be displayed
      Parameters:
      height - of this cell
      Returns:
      the right imageicon, or error icon
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • cellIsInValidCells

      public boolean cellIsInValidCells​(Cell targetCell, java.util.List<Cell> validCells)
      Tells if a cell got from user is a valid cell.
      Overrides:
      cellIsInValidCells in class View
      Parameters:
      targetCell - cell got from user.
      validCells - valid cells got from model.
      Returns:
      true if target cell is in the valid cells.

    • notPerimeterCell

      public boolean notPerimeterCell​(Cell targetCell)
      Since Hestia can't make her second build on a perimeter space, we check for this condition. A perimeter space is a cell that has x==0 || x==4 || y==0 || y==4.
      Overrides:
      notPerimeterCell in class View
      Parameters:
      targetCell - cell we are asking for.
      Returns:
      true if that cell is not on a perimeter zone of the battlefield.

    • isFree

      public boolean isFree​(Cell targetCell, ModelUtils modelCopy)
      Ask if a target cell of the battlefield is free or not. It is free if there is not a token on it nor a dome.
      Overrides:
      isFree in class View
      Parameters:
      targetCell - a cell we are asking for.
      modelCopy - model copy received from the server.
      Returns:
      true if that cell is free, false else.

    • buildGod

      public void buildGod​(Pack pack, Cell targetCell) throws java.io.IOException
      In case a player wants to use the power of Demeter or Hestia (the cases where you can build twice) the buttonHandler call this method (twice) to save the two targetCell. At the end of the second call the playerAction is sent.
      Parameters:
      pack - Pack of the serverResponse
      targetCell - The selected cell in which the player wants to build
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong

    • newValidBuilds

      public java.util.List<Cell> newValidBuilds​(Cell selectedCell)
      Recalculates the new valid builds in case one of these gods decided to use his power, and modifies the next move
      Parameters:
      selectedCell - cell that has been selected to perform build generallty
      Returns:
      the new valid builds

    • getToken

      public int getToken​(int posx, int posy, Player player)
      This method is called when a player selected the token he wants to move and return the ID of that token.
      Parameters:
      posx - The x position of the token selected in the board
      posy - The y position of the token selected in the board
      player - the player that selected the token
      Returns:
      the ID of the token of that player in that position. 0 if something went wrong.

    • getCell

      public Cell getCell​(int posx, int posy, Battlefield battlefield)
      Get an input from a player and return the corresponding cell of the battlefield.
      Parameters:
      posx - x
      posy - y
      battlefield - the model's battlefield copy received in server response.
      Returns:
      the cell of the battlefield with the coordinates written in inputs. Null if something goes wrong.
